response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "This measure appropriates moneys for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium that begins on July 1, 2025, and ends on June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_41] Your Committee recommends that the Judiciary budget be amended by providing an additional $1,000,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt) for civil legal services and $750,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt) for legal services to individuals in immigration-related court proceedings. [CHUNK_44] Your Committee has amended this measure by changing the effective date to April 23, 2057, to facilitate further discussion on the measure. [CHUNK_46]",
  "appropriations": "The Judiciary budget is to be amended by providing an additional $1,000,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt) for civil legal services and $750,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt) for legal services to individuals in immigration-related court proceedings. [CHUNK_44] The measure increases the appropriation for Administration (JUD601) by $1,750,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt). [CHUNK_45] General obligation bonds issued shall not exceed $11,900,000 (HB400_SD1_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_23]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The appropriations are based on the recognition of the current efforts of the federal government to downsize or eliminate certain federal programs and to increase the number and rate of deportations. [CHUNK_43] Your Committee further recognizes the potential impacts of these actions on people in Hawaii, including increased costs and adverse consequences for families and businesses. [CHUNK_44] The appropriations are intended to assist the Judiciary in its efforts to fulfill its constitutional and statutory duties during the 2025‑2027 fiscal biennium. [CHUNK_43]",
  "agency_impact": "The appropriation for Administration (JUD601) is increased by $1,750,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt). [CHUNK_45] The measure provides for an unspecified sum to be expended by Administration (JUD601) for civil legal services and for legal services for individuals in immigration-related proceedings in immigration court. [CHUNK_45] [CHUNK_46] The chief justice may transfer sufficient funds and positions between programs for operating purposes. [CHUNK_14]",
  "economic_impact": "The additional funding is a response to the potential impacts of federal actions on people in Hawaii, including increased costs and adverse consequences for families and businesses. [CHUNK_44] Appropriations made by this measure are intended to assist the Judiciary in its efforts to fulfill its constitutional and statutory duties. [CHUNK_43]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure has been amended to provide for an unspecified sum to be expended by Administration (JUD601) for civil legal services and legal services for individuals in immigration-related proceedings. [CHUNK_45] [CHUNK_46] This change is in response to efforts by the federal government to increase the number and rate of deportations. [CHUNK_43] The effective date has been changed to April 23, 2057, to facilitate further discussion on the measure. [CHUNK_46]",
  "revenue_sources": "The appropriation for Administration (JUD601) is increased by $1,750,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt), which comes from general funds. [CHUNK_45] General obligation bonds may be issued to finance projects, provided that the sum total of the general obligation bonds so issued shall not exceed $11,900,000 (HB400_SD1_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_23] Other sources of funding specified include special funds and revolving funds. [CHUNK_3]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "This measure appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_5] The Committee recommends that the Judiciary budget be amended by providing an additional $1,000,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt) for civil legal services and $750,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt) for legal services to individuals in immigration-related court proceedings. [CHUNK_44] The appropriation for Administration (JUD601) will be increased by $1,750,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt). [CHUNK_45] An unspecified sum of the general fund appropriation for administration (JUD601) shall be expended for civil legal services for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027. [CHUNK_12] A separate unspecified sum shall be expended on legal services for individuals in immigration-related proceedings in immigration court for the same fiscal years. [CHUNK_13] All appropriations made for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [CHUNK_25]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The appropriation for Administration (JUD601) has been increased by $1,750,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt). [CHUNK_45] This includes an additional $1,000,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt) for civil legal services and $750,000 (HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.htm.txt) for legal services for individuals in immigration-related court proceedings. [CHUNK_44] The effective date of the measure has been changed to April 23, 2057. [CHUNK_46]"
}

chunk_details.chunk_text: HB400 SD1 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 400 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 H.D. 1 STATE OF HAWAII S.D. 1 A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE JUDICIARY . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: PART I. GENERAL PROVISIONS SECTION 1. This Act shall be known

I. GENERAL PROVISIONS SECTION 1. This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. SECTION 2. Unless otherwise clear from the context, as used in this Act: "Means of Financing," or "MOF," means the source from which funds are appropriated, or authorized, as

the source from which funds are appropriated, or authorized, as the case may be, to be expended for the programs and projects specified in this Act. All appropriations are followed by letter symbols. The letter symbols, where used, shall have the following meanings: A General funds B Special funds C

the following meanings: A General funds B Special funds C General obligation bond funds W Revolving funds "Position ceiling" means the maximum number of permanent or temporary positions authorized for a particular program during a specified period or periods, as noted by an asterisk or pound sign, respectively. "Program ID"

noted by an asterisk or pound sign, respectively. "Program ID" means the unique identifier for the specific program, and consists of the abbreviation for the judiciary (JUD) followed by a designated number for the program. PART II. PROGRAM APPROPRIATIONS SECTION 3. The following sums, or so much thereof as may

3. The following sums, or so much thereof as may be sufficient to accomplish the purposes and programs designated herein, are appropriated or authorized from the sources of funding specified to the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. The total expenditures and the number of permanent and temporary positions established in each fiscal year of the fiscal biennium shall not exceed the sums and the position ceilings indicated for each year, except as provided in this Act. that no transfer shall be made to implement any collective bargaining contract signed after this legislature adjourns sine die. SECTION 7. Provided that if the chief justice, or any agency or government unit, secures federal funds or other property under any act of Congress, or any funds or other property

any act of Congress, or any funds or other property from private organizations or individuals, to be expended in connection with any program or works authorized by this Act or otherwise, the chief justice, or the agency or government unit with the chief justice's approval, may enter into the undertaking

with the chief justice's approval, may enter into the undertaking with the federal government, private organization, or individual. SECTION 8. Provided that the judiciary may transfer savings from its general fund appropriation to the driver education and training fund to accommodate any temporary cash flow deficits. PART IV. CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT

accommodate any temporary cash flow deficits. PART IV. CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS SECTION 9. The sums appropriated or authorized in part II of this Act for capital improvement projects shall be expended by the judiciary for the projects listed below; provided that several related or similar projects may be combined into

that several related or similar projects may be combined into a single project, if a combination is advantageous or convenient for implementation; provided further that the total cost of the projects thus combined shall not exceed the total of the sums specified for the projects separately. sums specified for the projects separately. The amount after each cost element and the total funding for each project listed in this part are in thousands of dollars. JUD601 - ADMINISTRATION 1. provided by law, to yield the amount that may be necessary to finance projects authorized in part II and listed in part IV of this Act; provided that the sum total of the general obligation bonds so issued shall not exceed $11,900,000 . PART VI. SPECIAL PROVISIONS SECTION 11. Any

exceed $11,900,000 . PART VI. SPECIAL PROVISIONS SECTION 11. Any law or any provision of this Act to the contrary notwithstanding, the appropriations made for capital improvement projects authorized in part II and listed in part IV of this Act shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year

shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made; provided that all appropriations made for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. SECTION 12. The judiciary may delegate to

of that date. SECTION 12. The judiciary may delegate to other state or county agencies the planning, acquisition of land, design, construction, and equipment of any capital improvement project when it is determined by the judiciary to be advantageous to do so. SECTION 13. All unrequired balances in the general

do so. SECTION 13. All unrequired balances in the general obligation bond fund, after the objectives of part II appropriations for capital improvements program purposes listed as projects in part IV of this Act have been met, shall be transferred to the judiciary project adjustment fund. SECTION 14. If the

to the judiciary project adjustment fund. SECTION 14. If the amount allocated from the general obligation bond fund for a capital improvement project listed in part IV of this Act is insufficient, the chief justice may make supplemental allotments from the project adjustment fund; provided that supplemental allotments shall not

the project adjustment fund; provided that supplemental allotments shall not be used to increase the scope of the project. SECTION 15. Where it has been determined that changed conditions, such as a reduction in the particular population being served, permit the reduction in the scope of a project listed in

the reduction in the scope of a project listed in part IV of this Act, the chief justice may authorize the reduction of project scope. SECTION 16. The chief justice shall determine when and the manner in which the authorized capital improvement projects shall be initiated. The chief justice shall

capital improvement projects shall be initiated. The chief justice shall notify the governor from time to time of the specific amounts required for the projects, and the governor shall provide for those amounts through the issuance of bonds authorized in part II and listed in part IV of this Act.

part II and listed in part IV of this Act. SECTION 17. Any law or any provision of this Act to the contrary notwithstanding, the chief justice may supplement funds for any cost element of a capital improvement project authorized under this Act by transferring sums as may be needed

under this Act by transferring sums as may be needed from the funds appropriated for other cost elements of the same project by this Act or by any other prior or future Act that has not lapsed; provided that the total expenditure of funds for all cost elements for the

total expenditure of funds for all cost elements for the project shall not exceed the total appropriation for that project. PART VII. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS AND EFFECTIVE DATE SECTION 18. If any portion of this Act or its application to any person or circumstances is held to be invalid for any

person or circumstances is held to be invalid for any reason, the remainder of this Act and any provision thereof shall not be affected. If any portion of a specific appropriation is held to be invalid for any reason, the remaining portion shall be independent of the invalid portion and

remaining portion shall be independent of the invalid portion and shall be expended to fulfill the objective and intent of the appropriation to the extent possible. SECTION 19. If any manifest clerical, typographical, or other mechanical error is found in this Act, the chief justice may correct the error. All

this Act, the chief justice may correct the error. All changes made pursuant to this section shall be reported to the legislature at its next regular session. SECTION 20. This Act shall take effect on April 23, 2057. Report Title: Judiciary Package; Appropriations; Budget Description: Appropriates funds for the Judiciary

Judiciary Package; Appropriations; Budget Description: Appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. Effective 4/23/2057. (SD1) The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.

SSCR1253 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 1253 Honolulu, Hawaii RE: H.B. No. 400 H.D. 1 S.D. 1 Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Sir: Your Committee on Judiciary, to which was referred H.B. No. 400, H.D. 1, entitled: "A

which was referred H.B. No. 400, H.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE JUDICIARY," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose and intent of this measure is to provide for the expenses of the judicial branch of the State of Hawaii. Specifically, this measure appropriates

branch of the State of Hawaii. Specifically, this measure appropriates moneys for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium that begins on July 1, 2025, and ends on June 30, 2027. Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the Judiciary, Department of Education, Volunteer Legal Services Hawaii, The

the Judiciary, Department of Education, Volunteer Legal Services Hawaii, The Legal Clinic, Hawaii State Bar Association, SanHi Government Strategies, Legal Aid Society of Hawaii, and one individual. Your Committee finds that the appropriations made by this measure are intended to assist the Judiciary in its efforts to fulfill its constitutional

assist the Judiciary in its efforts to fulfill its constitutional and statutory duties during the 2025‑2027 fiscal biennium. Your Committee recognizes the current efforts of the federal government to downsize or eliminate certain federal programs and to increase the number and rate of deportations. Your Committee further recognizes the potential

and rate of deportations. Your Committee further recognizes the potential impacts of these actions on people in Hawaii, including increased costs and adverse consequences for families and businesses. Accordingly, your Committee recommends that the Judiciary budget be amended by providing an additional $1,000,000 for civil legal services and $750,000 for

an additional $1,000,000 for civil legal services and $750,000 for legal services to individuals in immigration-related court proceedings. Your Committee has amended this measure by: (1) Increasing the appropriation for Administration (JUD601) by $1,750,000; (2) Providing for an unspecified sum to be expended by Administration (JUD601) for civil legal services;

to be expended by Administration (JUD601) for civil legal services; (3) Providing for an unspecified sum to be expended by Administration (JUD601) for legal services for individuals in immigration-related proceedings in immigration court; and (4) Changing the effective date to April 23, 2057, to facilitate further discussion on the measure.

April 23, 2057, to facilitate further discussion on the measure. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Judiciary that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 400, H.D. 1, as amended herein,

purpose of H.B. No. 400, H.D. 1, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Second Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 400, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, and be referred to your Committee on Ways and Means. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee
Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Judiciary, ________________________________ KARL RHOADS, Chair

HB400_SD1_SSCR1253_.chunk_text: HB400 SD1 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 400 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 H.D. 1 STATE OF HAWAII S.D. 1 A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE JUDICIARY . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: PART I. GENERAL PROVISIONS SECTION 1. This Act shall be known

I. GENERAL PROVISIONS SECTION 1. This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. SECTION 2. Unless otherwise clear from the context, as used in this Act: "Means of Financing," or "MOF," means the source from which funds are appropriated, or authorized, as

the source from which funds are appropriated, or authorized, as the case may be, to be expended for the programs and projects specified in this Act. All appropriations are followed by letter symbols. The letter symbols, where used, shall have the following meanings: A General funds B Special funds C

the following meanings: A General funds B Special funds C General obligation bond funds W Revolving funds "Position ceiling" means the maximum number of permanent or temporary positions authorized for a particular program during a specified period or periods, as noted by an asterisk or pound sign, respectively. "Program ID"

noted by an asterisk or pound sign, respectively. "Program ID" means the unique identifier for the specific program, and consists of the abbreviation for the judiciary (JUD) followed by a designated number for the program. PART II. PROGRAM APPROPRIATIONS SECTION 3. The following sums, or so much thereof as may

3. The following sums, or so much thereof as may be sufficient to accomplish the purposes and programs designated herein, are appropriated or authorized from the sources of funding specified to the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. The total expenditures and

2025, and ending June 30, 2027. The total expenditures and the number of permanent and temporary positions established in each fiscal year of the fiscal biennium shall not exceed the sums and the position ceilings indicated for each year, except as provided in this Act. that no transfer shall be made to implement any collective bargaining contract signed after this legislature adjourns sine die. SECTION 7. Provided that if the chief justice, or any agency or government unit, secures federal funds or other property under any act of Congress, or any funds or other property

any act of Congress, or any funds or other property from private organizations or individuals, to be expended in connection with any program or works authorized by this Act or otherwise, the chief justice, or the agency or government unit with the chief justice's approval, may enter into the undertaking

with the chief justice's approval, may enter into the undertaking with the federal government, private organization, or individual. SECTION 8. Provided that the judiciary may transfer savings from its general fund appropriation to the driver education and training fund to accommodate any temporary cash flow deficits. PART IV. CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT

accommodate any temporary cash flow deficits. PART IV. CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS SECTION 9. The sums appropriated or authorized in part II of this Act for capital improvement projects shall be expended by the judiciary for the projects listed below; provided that several related or similar projects may be combined into

that several related or similar projects may be combined into a single project, if a combination is advantageous or convenient for implementation; provided further that the total cost of the projects thus combined shall not exceed the total of the sums specified for the projects separately. sums specified for the projects separately. The amount after each cost element and the total funding for each project listed in this part are in thousands of dollars. JUD601 - ADMINISTRATION 1. provided by law, to yield the amount that may be necessary to finance projects authorized in part II and listed in part IV of this Act; provided that the sum total of the general obligation bonds so issued shall not exceed $11,900,000 . PART VI. SPECIAL PROVISIONS SECTION 11. Any

exceed $11,900,000 . PART VI. SPECIAL PROVISIONS SECTION 11. Any law or any provision of this Act to the contrary notwithstanding, the appropriations made for capital improvement projects authorized in part II and listed in part IV of this Act shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year

shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made; provided that all appropriations made for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. SECTION 12. The judiciary may delegate to

of that date. SECTION 12. The judiciary may delegate to other state or county agencies the planning, acquisition of land, design, construction, and equipment of any capital improvement project when it is determined by the judiciary to be advantageous to do so. SECTION 13. All unrequired balances in the general

do so. SECTION 13. All unrequired balances in the general obligation bond fund, after the objectives of part II appropriations for capital improvements program purposes listed as projects in part IV of this Act have been met, shall be transferred to the judiciary project adjustment fund. SECTION 14. If the

to the judiciary project adjustment fund. SECTION 14. If the amount allocated from the general obligation bond fund for a capital improvement project listed in part IV of this Act is insufficient, the chief justice may make supplemental allotments from the project adjustment fund; provided that supplemental allotments shall not

the project adjustment fund; provided that supplemental allotments shall not be used to increase the scope of the project. SECTION 15. Where it has been determined that changed conditions, such as a reduction in the particular population being served, permit the reduction in the scope of a project listed in

the reduction in the scope of a project listed in part IV of this Act, the chief justice may authorize the reduction of project scope. SECTION 16. The chief justice shall determine when and the manner in which the authorized capital improvement projects shall be initiated. The chief justice shall

capital improvement projects shall be initiated. The chief justice shall notify the governor from time to time of the specific amounts required for the projects, and the governor shall provide for those amounts through the issuance of bonds authorized in part II and listed in part IV of this Act.

part II and listed in part IV of this Act. SECTION 17. Any law or any provision of this Act to the contrary notwithstanding, the chief justice may supplement funds for any cost element of a capital improvement project authorized under this Act by transferring sums as may be needed

under this Act by transferring sums as may be needed from the funds appropriated for other cost elements of the same project by this Act or by any other prior or future Act that has not lapsed; provided that the total expenditure of funds for all cost elements for the

total expenditure of funds for all cost elements for the project shall not exceed the total appropriation for that project. PART VII. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS AND EFFECTIVE DATE SECTION 18. If any portion of this Act or its application to any person or circumstances is held to be invalid for any

person or circumstances is held to be invalid for any reason, the remainder of this Act and any provision thereof shall not be affected. If any portion of a specific appropriation is held to be invalid for any reason, the remaining portion shall be independent of the invalid portion and

remaining portion shall be independent of the invalid portion and shall be expended to fulfill the objective and intent of the appropriation to the extent possible. SECTION 19. If any manifest clerical, typographical, or other mechanical error is found in this Act, the chief justice may correct the error. All

this Act, the chief justice may correct the error. All changes made pursuant to this section shall be reported to the legislature at its next regular session. SECTION 20. This Act shall take effect on April 23, 2057. Report Title: Judiciary Package; Appropriations; Budget Description: Appropriates funds for the Judiciary

Judiciary Package; Appropriations; Budget Description: Appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. Effective 4/23/2057. (SD1) The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.

SSCR1253 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 1253 Honolulu, Hawaii RE: H.B. No. 400 H.D. 1 S.D. 1 Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Sir: Your Committee on Judiciary, to which was referred H.B. No. 400, H.D. 1, entitled: "A

which was referred H.B. No. 400, H.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE JUDICIARY," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose and intent of this measure is to provide for the expenses of the judicial branch of the State of Hawaii. Specifically, this measure appropriates

branch of the State of Hawaii. Specifically, this measure appropriates moneys for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium that begins on July 1, 2025, and ends on June 30, 2027. Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the Judiciary, Department of Education, Volunteer Legal Services Hawaii, The

the Judiciary, Department of Education, Volunteer Legal Services Hawaii, The Legal Clinic, Hawaii State Bar Association, SanHi Government Strategies, Legal Aid Society of Hawaii, and one individual. Your Committee finds that the appropriations made by this measure are intended to assist the Judiciary in its efforts to fulfill its constitutional

assist the Judiciary in its efforts to fulfill its constitutional and statutory duties during the 2025‑2027 fiscal biennium. Your Committee recognizes the current efforts of the federal government to downsize or eliminate certain federal programs and to increase the number and rate of deportations. Your Committee further recognizes the potential

and rate of deportations. Your Committee further recognizes the potential impacts of these actions on people in Hawaii, including increased costs and adverse consequences for families and businesses. Accordingly, your Committee recommends that the Judiciary budget be amended by providing an additional $1,000,000 for civil legal services and $750,000 for

an additional $1,000,000 for civil legal services and $750,000 for legal services to individuals in immigration-related court proceedings. Your Committee has amended this measure by: (1) Increasing the appropriation for Administration (JUD601) by $1,750,000; (2) Providing for an unspecified sum to be expended by Administration (JUD601) for civil legal services;

to be expended by Administration (JUD601) for civil legal services; (3) Providing for an unspecified sum to be expended by Administration (JUD601) for legal services for individuals in immigration-related proceedings in immigration court; and (4) Changing the effective date to April 23, 2057, to facilitate further discussion on the measure.

April 23, 2057, to facilitate further discussion on the measure. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Judiciary that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 400, H.D. 1, as amended herein,

purpose of H.B. No. 400, H.D. 1, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Second Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 400, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, and be referred to your Committee on Ways and Means. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee
Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Judiciary, ________________________________ KARL RHOADS, Chair
